greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) of k-block T_0-tricoverings of an n-set, n >= 3, k = 0..2*n.
comment: A covering of a set is a tricovering if every element of the set is covered by exactly three blocks of the covering. A covering of a set is a T_0-covering if for every two distinct elements of the set there exists a block of the covering containing one but not the other element.
reference: I. P. Goulden and D. M. Jackson, Combinatorial Enumeration, John Wiley and Sons, N.Y., 1983.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1674
formula: E.g.f. for k-block T_0-tricoverings of an n-set is exp(-x+1/2*x^2+1/3*x^3*y)*Sum_{i=0..inf}(1+y)^binomial(i, 3)*exp(-1/2*x^2*(1+y)^i)*x^i/i!.
T(n,k) = 0 for n > binomial(k, 3). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 30 2020
example: There are 5 = 1 + 3 + 1 T_0-tricoverings of a 3-set and 175 = 1 + 39 + 89 + 43 + 3 T_0-tricoverings of a 4-set, cf. A060070.
program: C(k)=if(k<4, [], Vecrev(serlaplace(polcoef(exp(-x + x^2/2 + x^3*y/3 + O(x*x^k))*sum(i=0, 2*k, (1+y)^binomial(i, 3)*exp(-x^2*(1+y)^i/2 + O(x*x^k))*x^i/i!), k))/y)) \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 30 2020

T(n)={my(m=2*n, y='y + O('y^(n+1))); my(g=exp(-x + x^2/2 + x^3*y/3 + O(x*x^m))*sum(k=0, m, (1+y)^binomial(k, 3)*exp(-x^2*(1+y)^k/2 + O(x*x^m))*x^k/k!)); Mat([Col(serlaplace(p), -n) | p<-Vec(g)[2..m+1]]);}
{ my(A=T(8)); for(n=3, matsize(A)[1], print(concat([0], A[n, 1..2*n]))) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 30 2020
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 22 2001
